title: Love Island Australia's first same-sex couple are already over
text:
Love Island Australia's Phoebe Thompson and Cassie Lansdell were coupled up during Monday night's episode.

And just a day later, their lesbian romance was over, with Phoebe, 28, accusing Cassie, 26, of using her as a 'game plan'.

After Cassie enjoyed a date with the hunky twin intruders Josh and Luke Packham, Phoebe suggested they 'take a step back'.

'I feel like you chose me in order to stay': Love Island Australia's first same-sex couple are already over. Phoebe Thompson (left) dumped Cassie Lansdell (right) on Tuesday, after her date with twin intruders Josh and Luke Packham

Early on in the episode, Cassie went on a date with intruder Luke Packham, 25, after he expressed an interest in getting to know her.

Little did she know that Luke has a twin brother Josh, who would replace him in the second half of their date.

Arriving back at the villa, Cassie told her co-stars that she definitely felt 'a spark' with Luke, causing Phoebe to feel threatened.

Pulling her aside, Phoebe accused Cassie of only coupling up with her to stay in the competition.

Exploring other avenues: Early on in the episode, Cassie went on a date with intruder Luke Packham (right), 25, after he expressed an interest in getting to know her

Double trouble: Little did she know that Luke has a twin brother Josh, who would replace him in the second half of their date

'I'm getting quite emotional thinking about the decision that I made, and there's a part of me that feels like you wanted to couple up with me so you could stay here,' she began.

'Are you kidding me?' a shell-shocked Cassie remarked.

Phoebe responded: 'It's just like, from every conversation that I've had with you, those boys are not your type. I don't know, something just doesn't feel right to me.'

Phoebe suggested they cool things off and let nature run its course.

Confrontation: Phoebe accused Cassie of only coupling up with her to stay in the competition: 'There's a part of me that feels like you wanted to couple up with me so you could stay here'

'I honestly feel like I should take a step back and let you see what can happen,' she said.

Cassie broke down in tears and questioned why this 'always happens' to her.

'I really didn't want to make you upset,' Phoebe said, attempting to console her.

'I don't want this to turn into something not nice,' she added.

'I don't want anything bad to happen because I'd just rather have you in my life as a friend.'
description: Love Island Australia's Phoebe Thompson and Cassie Lansdell were coupled up during Monday night's episode.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
